fields.description:
{panel:title=UPDATE 2019-02-13|borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#cccccc|titleBGColor=#f7d6c1|bgColor=#ffffce}
Hi everyone,

In Jira Cloud we use rate limiting for REST API to protect our customers' sites (aka tenants) resources. Current implementation isn’t based on REST API consumer, it is based on concurrent requests made across all consumers of single tenant - consider tenant users, your App and other Apps accessing the infrastructure. Thus it is a challenge to provide meaningful, guaranteed information for consumer in response headers (e.g. Retry-After), such information could be seen only as a suggestion.

In case of implementing retries please be advised of using back-off mechanism to lower retry frequency on subsequent failed attempts and increase traffic gradually on a success. Concurrency based limiting is more visible for longer requests so the rule of thumb would be the longer request is the lower concurrency should be used.

We are actively working on per consumer rate limiting which should help us provide meaningful information in response headers. We expect it to be delivered in couple of quarters.

With regard to this issue we’ll fix it by not returning 500 and provide suggestion (as described above) when retry may happen.
{panel}
h3. Summary

Calling search or other REST API endpoints might return status code 500 instead of status code 429 when the error {{FATAL: too many connections for role...}} is logged.

Sometimes other random status codes like 503, 400 or 403 are returned for the same root-cause.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Send REST APIs calls (in example the Search endpoint was used) in continuous succession

h3. Expected Results

If the rate limit is hit, the status 429. Throttling limit state should be returned in headers like [here|https://developers.trello.com/docs/rate-limits]
h3. Actual Results

Different status codes including 500, 503, 400 and 403 are returned instead.
fields.summary: Report 503 instead of 500 in case of "FATAL: too many connections for role"

fields.description: In Jira-Slack settings there is no option to filter notifications by assigned on me only. Please, add this feature in order to receive notifications into slack account as it is being received by mail.
fields.summary: Jira Slack: add setting to recieve only watcher tasks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Import from Server to Cloud failing with NullPointerException


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate a backup on Server
# Start an import into Cloud using the backup generated from Server

h3. Expected Results
The import would complete successfully

h3. Actual Results
The import fails with the following error:
{code}
Error importing data: com.atlassian.jira.log.clean.PrivacySafeException: Privacy-safe boxing of a java.lang.NullPointerException
{code}
 
h3. Workaround
This error is an intermittent error, therefore, *trying a new import* could work.
In case the problem persists after multiple attempts, contact support.
fields.summary: Import from Server to Cloud failing with NullPointerException

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As a Jira administrator, I CSV exported a list of Jira issues through the advanced search in order to later import this data using the CSV external system importer.

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

If a comment is among the data exported, the commenter is presented in the CSV file with the username value.

!screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!

Since the username is getting deprecated as per [Deprecation notice and migration guide for major changes to Jira Cloud REST APIs to improve user privacy|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/deprecation-notice-user-privacy-api-migration-guide/]. We should have a replacement for this value.
h3. Suggested Solution

Export the account id value rather than the username.
h3. Why this is important

Currently, the external system importer cannot identify the account id value if set in the CSV file. If the username gets deprecated the import process will get broken.
h3. Workaround

(/) You may use the email address instead of username or account ID to identify the users.

(!) This workaround does not work for custom fields yet.
fields.summary: Jira export/import should use the account id to follow the username deprecation process

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If Google Chrome (version 73) is configured with a highest priority language different from what is configured in Jira, Jira will sometimes "forget" the default language.

The video below better illustrates the behaviour:

 [^JRACLOUD-71868.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Make sure you have highest priority language in your Chrome set differently than what you have in Jira;
* Access the Cloud instance.

h3. Expected Results
* Jira will be presented in the language set up on your profile.

h3. Actual Results
* Jira will sometimes be presented in the Chrome's highest priority language.

h3. Workaround(s)
* Access your profile settings, then modify any configuration (and change it back). Just reload the page, then.
fields.summary: Jira eventually "forgets" the default language if Chrome is configured with a different highest priority language

fields.description:
It would be nice if Jira was able to show the user account which it does not has permission to access the file and provide an option to authenticate with another account which has access to the file.

*Scenario:*
Sometimes, users authenticate on each other machine and when portal only customers(Service Desk) receives the link via email, they receive a link pointing to the file itself and in case they are not authenticated with the appropriate account they will receive a 403 error.
fields.summary: Improve 403 Forbidden message

fields.summary: .mov support for issue description

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Custom Field *User Picker (multiple users)* is removing the users that had their usernames changed when you're editing the field.

You can check [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/346622/user%20picker.gif] a short video about this problem.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a User: *charlie*
# Change their user_name to *atlassian* (customer could have it done themselves prior to the username deprecation). This will cause the user_name to be different from the user_key.
# Create a *User Picker (multiple users)* custom field and associate it to a project.
# Create an issue, and under the user picker custom field, include *atlassian* user and save the field using the *Old Issue View*.
# Click to edit the field and *atlassian* user will not be displayed and then click on Save icon and the user will be removed from the field.
# Add the *atlassian* user again.
# Go to the *Edit Issue* page, the user picker field will not display *atlassian* user even after you added again. 

h3. Expected Results

The users should not be removed from the field while you're editing it.

h3. Actual Results

If you edit a *User Picker (multiple users)* using the Old Issue View, the users, that had their usernames changed, will be removed from the field. Also, they will not be displayed as a value in the field on the Edit Issue screen.

h3. Workaround

This problem is not happening in the New Issue View, so, in case it's available, you can use it as a workaround.

h4. Note 

This also can happen in the *new issue view* if you assign a *screen* (containing the multi-user field) to a workflow transition
fields.summary: Custom Field User Picker (multiple users) is removing some users while you're editing the field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The history in the new issue view does not display break lines

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Using the new issue view, create an issue in a project (classic or next-gen)
# Change the description field and add a description to the created issue with some text and line break
# Edit the description of the issue, adding more text and line break
# Check the issue's history

h3. Expected Results

The history displays the changing information with the line breaks, like the old issue view

 !Screen Shot 2019-04-08 at 2.44.03 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The history displays text without line breaks

 !Screen Shot 2019-04-08 at 2.44.20 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround

Disable the new issue view by following the steps described below (not applicable for next-gen projects):

# Go to Jira home page and click on the avatar at the bottom-left of the screen and then click on *Personal settings*
# Under *Jira labs*, next to *New Jira issue view for software projects*, disable this feature by clicking on the green button (it will become gray and a feedback pop-up will appear)
fields.summary: The history in the new issue view does not display break lines

fields.description:
h3. Summary

This is not replicable on every instance.

In some cases, we cannot delete parent issues when they have sub-tasks with resolutions. 

In the old issue view, Jira will show a successful message saying the ticket was deleted, but it's not. If you were previously on a page listing the issue, you may be redirected to it again and the issue may not be there, but refreshing the page reveals it. It still exists.

In the new issue view, you'll see this error:
{code}
We couldn't delete <issue key>

Check your connection, then give it another try.

Try again
{code}
!error.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project (has been tested with Kanban and business). Make sure it has a sub-task type
# Create a ticket and a sub-task to it
# Close the sub-task, adding a resolution to it
# Try to delete the *parent*

h3. Expected Results
The parent is deleted

h3. Actual Results
The behavior described above is seen. The tickets are not deleted. 
If the parent had sub-tasks without resolution, some of these may have been deleted.

h3. Note
The problem here is the sub-task preventing the parent from being deleted. We can delete the sub-task and we can delete the parent once the sub-task is deleted. What fails is deleting the parent while the sub-task is there.
 
In original testing, closed sub-task without resolution were also causing this, but with a different error in UI (same errors in logs). However, in recent testing, we could only replicate with sub-tasks with resolutions.

h3.Workaround
Delete all sub-tasks with resolutions first.
fields.summary: Unable to delete some issues with resolved sub-tasks

It would be beneficial if we could allow the ability to add an alert/window pop-up on the issue screen to alert user when they are using a custom field. Similar to this documentation :

https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-add-a-message-or-field-on-jira-create-issue-screen-759990667.html

fields.description:
+*Problem Definition*+
Customers want the ability to see which fields are responsible for the errors generated when performing CSV imports. 

Example: 2019-04-03 18:33:04,134 ERROR - Issue can't be created due to the error/s [ The entered text is too long. It exceeds the allowed limit of 255 characters. ]

+*Suggested Solution*+
Include the field name to the error message whenever a field is causing it.

+*Why this is important*+
Customer will be able to identify what causes the error.
fields.summary: Add Field Name to CSV import logs

fields.description:
In global permission scheme settings:

1. Find a scheme which has a project associated with it.
2. Click the delete link on the scheme, a page is shown which explains that the project will be reassociated to the default scheme
3. Confirm the deletion

Expected: the scheme is deleted and the project is reassociated
Actual: an error is shown saying the scheme cannot be deleted when it has an associated project
fields.summary: Deleting a scheme with associated projects in global permission settings gives an error

fields.description:
Currently it is only possible to link Confluence pages to sprints, or in general in JIRA. However, Confluence is slow and cumbersome and no one likes it. So we're creating our sprint one pages in Google docs. Thus it would be great to be able to add links to the sprint instead of only Confluence pages.

Sprint one pagers outline the goal, the timeline and the team members. We print out those one pages and out it on the walls in our offices.
fields.summary: Allow users to add links to sprints

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

When trying to use the Code Block function in the comments field, when choosing any language, it just saves as the default code block, not saving the selected language.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1) Go to an issue
2) Click to add a new comment
3) Choose the option "<>" to add a code block
4) Insert the code
5) Select a language
6) Save the comment

 [^codeblock.mp4]
h3. Expected Results

The comment should show the code block according to the selected language.

If you select SQL, it should save the code block as "code:sql" "code".
h3. Actual Results

The comment is showing the code block as a regular code block, ignoring the selected language.

If you select SQL, it will save the code block as "code" "code".
h3. Workaround

Turn off the old issue view and add the code you want.
fields.summary: New Jira issue view - Code Block not saving selected language.

fields.description: Once logged work on sub-tasks, in the new view the parent is not being updated with the subtasks work log, but in the old view, the time tracking is adding the work log properly. We would like that in the new view summed the work log of sub-tasks as well.
fields.summary: Parent is not being updated with the subtasks work logs

* Test Dashboard 2

* Wallboard slideshow

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The "Import issues" button on the issue create screen does not work when trying it from within a project. However, when creating an issue being on the dashboard page the same button works and redirects the user to "External system import" page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a project and use the '+' icon on the left bar to create an issue.
 # Click on the "Import issues" button on the top.


h3. Expected Results

The user is redirected to the "External system import" page.
h3. Actual Results

No result. The below console errors are seen.
 !Screen Shot 2019-04-05 at 3.32.55 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Directly access "External System import" from the Jira system settings.
Or, use the import issues feature from the issue navigator:
 !Screen Shot 2019-04-05 at 11.32.39.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Import issues button on the create issue screen not working

fields.description: The Jira Cloud Slack App allows a user to view information about an issue including status, Priority, assignee, and other details. It currently doesn't allow anything but read access to these issues. It would be nice to be able to transition tasks, change assignees, edit the issue, comment directly from the app.
fields.summary: Allow Management of issues in Slack App

fields.description:
In the old view when the user has the edit issue permission restricted, if the user clicks on the issue type icon, nothing happens, but in the new view the user can see the list of issue types, but the user cannot change the issue type.

That being said, we would like to hide the issue type dropdown list if the user has permission restricted to change the issue type.
fields.summary: Hide the issue types dropdown list if the permission is restricted.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The new issue view does not refresh the content to display the new comment added via a workflow transition right after it is made.

It is necessary to manually refresh the page.

See the recording:  [^Comment via transition - new issue view.mp4] 

h2. Update

It seems that it affects not only comments, but, for example, if the transition screen would include the Description field, the same would happen.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Associate a screen with a transition in your workflow;
# Perform that transition, adding a comment;
# Notice that the comment is not displayed after the transition is completed.

h3. Expected results

The new comment will be displayed right after the transition is completed.

h3. Actual results

The new comment is not loaded into the page.
 !2019-07-04_17-24-37.gif|width=400&height=200! 

h3. Workaround

Manually refresh the page.

Also, the old view does not have such behaviour. 
In order to turn off the new issue view, do the following (works only for non-Next-gen software projects):
* Profile icon -> Personal settings -> disable the *Jira Labs* feature.
fields.summary: New issue view won't display new content added via workflow transition

fields.description:
Currently, there's an icon that is shown on Gadgets when using Components, it would be great to have the ability to change the icon picture or to remove it if desired.

How to reproduce

# Create a Two Dimensional gadget
# Add the components as X or Y axis

 !Screen Shot 2019-04-04 at 12.17.54.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to remove or edit the icon from components in Gadgets

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*
Users need the ability to disable the *Atlassian Community* button inside the *Help* session due to heavy regulations of some industries to restrict access and audit data.
 !image-2019-04-04-11-33-58-631.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Suggested Solution*
Customize Jira in a way that it's possible to enable and disable the *Atlassian Community* button inside the *Help* menu.

h3. *Why this is important*
With this suggestion, the level of customization of access to users would be increased and more customers that might have the same need would be able to use it.
fields.summary: Ability to disable/enable the Atlassian Community button in the Help session

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

When an issue is mentioned on Confluence page, the page will be displayed in the Confluence Pages in the Issue View, however, if the same issue is displayed in too many pages, the list will be too long.

 !Confluence pages.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Suggested Solution*

Include the ability to collapse the Confluence Pages in the Issue View.


h3. *Why this is important*

With this option, it will help to navigate in issues that are mentioned in too many pages.
fields.summary: Include the ability to collapse the Confluence Pages mentions in the New Issue View.

fields.description:
Currently, only the Jira app for Android has the option "Do not disturb" to set notifications for specific day and time.
It would be great if we could have the same option for iPhone.
fields.summary: Ability to schedule notification on iPhone app the same as Android

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using basic issue search and limiting to a single project and status will display all next-gen statuses of the same name with a red exclamation mark when the page is refreshed

h3. Environment
* Cloud with next-gen projects

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a classic project with an available status of _Done_
# Create a next-gen project with the same statuses as a classic project.
# Use the basic issue search for issues with the _Done_ status.
# Limit the scope of the search to just the classic project.
# Refresh the page.

h3. Expected Results
The search fields remain the same after the page is refreshed  

h3. Actual Results
The privately scoped statuses for the next-gen project are detected and displayed in the status filter box with a red exclamation mark. 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround
After refreshing the page you will need to deselect and reselect the desired status or project.
fields.summary: Using basic issue search and limiting to a single project and status will display all next-gen statuses of the same name with a red exclamation mark when the page is refreshed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Due to a longer project role name, the Remove option in the People tab gets overlapped

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project role with a long name (e.g. Users - HR BPO External Users)
# Go to the People tab in project settings. Associate a user/group with the new role created
 !People.PNG|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2019-04-04 at 15.10.14.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The long project role name should not overlap the Remove option.

h3. Actual Results
The long project role name overlaps the Remove option.

h3.Workaround
No Workaround.
fields.summary: Project role name overlaps Remove option in People tab

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When visiting an /issues/ Issue Search page directly, user gets constantly 500 error page with the following message.
{noformat}
Something went wrong
[...]
Error type: 500 - Internal server error
{noformat}

h3. Steps to reproduce
1. Run advanced JQL search on /issues/ page, enter an invalid query, e.g. `ORDER BY key` - expect to see `An unknown error occurred while trying to perform a search.` error message
2. open /issues/ page in a new browser tab (to ensure full page load)

h3. Expected Results
Search page with no result presented.

h3. Actual Results
I'm getting constantly 500 error page.

h3. Workaround
Go to any other Jira page, pick up existing filter and run a valid JQL query
fields.summary: 500 error on Issue Search page when last JQL query was invalid
Creating Issue via v3 API fails if Multi-line Text Field is defined

fields.description: Ability to disable the "We're updating the issue view to help you get more done. Learn more" message, given that the only way to get rid of the message is to revert to the old view, which we don't want to do.
fields.summary: Ability to disable the "We're updating the issue view to help you get more done. Learn more" message

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

On the New Issue view, when the Issue type field is removed from Screen, switching IssueType is not possible but Jira sends a "success message" that the IssueType has been change when in reality no changes was done.
 !wrong-success-message.png|thumbnail!
{panel:title=Reproducing the Problem|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
 - Navigate to the *Project Settings > Screens* and remove the IssueType Field from the Screen for an IssueType
 !issuetype.png|thumbnail!
 - Open up an Issue on the new Issue view and Attempt to change to a different IssueType{panel}
h3. *Expected Result*
 * The IssueType change should not be possible at all since the field is not present on screen.

h3. *Actual Result*
 * A "Success Message" is displayed on screen on the new Issue view as change is possible and on the Old Issue view, the edit ability is not visible to even change the Issue type.
 !wrong-success-message.png|thumbnail! 
 !old-issue-view.png|thumbnail!

h3. *Suggestion*
 * Remove the "Success Message" and replace with an "Error Message" instead because the IssueType is not changed at all and this will confuse the user on what is actually being done by Jira.

h3. *Workaround*
 * Ensure that the IssueType field is added to the screen of the IssueType from *Project Settings > Screens*
fields.summary: Switching IssueType throws a "Success Message" when the IssueType field is removed from Screen on the New Issue view

fields.description: When a new subtask is created, there should be functionality to have the status for tne subtask like the parent task
fields.summary: Ability to copy parent status to subtask

fields.description:
h3. Description
Vendors reported an issue about REST API timeouts and we are seeing PSQL exception on the affected instances
{code}
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: Unable to establish a connection with the database. (PSQL_TOO_MANY_CONNECTIONS Exception already occurred in this workcontext, skipping next getConnection)
    at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.findByAnd(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:91)
    at com.atlassian.jira.application.OfBizApplicationRoleStore.getById(OfBizApplicationRoleStore.java:150)
    at com.atlassian.jira.application.OfBizApplicationRoleStore.get(OfBizApplicationRoleStore.java:50)
    at com.atlassian.jira.application.DelegatingApplicationRoleStore.get(DelegatingApplicationRoleStore.java:34)
    at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager.applicationRoleDefinitionToApplicationRole(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:652)
    at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager.lambda$findDefinitionApplicationRole$18(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:647)
    at com.atlassian.fugue.Option.map(Option.java:272)
    at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager.findDefinitionApplicationRole(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:647)
    at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager.loadRole(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:639)
    at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager.lambda$getRole$1(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:173)
    at com.atlassian.vcache.internal.core.metrics.TimedSupplier.get(TimedSupplier.java:32)
    at com.atlassian.vcache.internal.core.service.DefaultRequestCache.lambda$get$2(DefaultRequestCache.java:52)
    at java.util.Optional.orElseGet(Optional.java:267)
{code}

h3. Side note
(!) The spike can been seen between 12am and 6am on Apr, 3 SYD time (GMT +11) originate from the us-east-1. Please raised a [Support ticket|https://support.atlassian.com/contact] if you experiencing the same behavior.
fields.summary: PSQL exception on third-party addons

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Use a user's display name as part of JQL no longer works and says that the value does not exist for the field. For example 
{code}
assignee = "Ian Gil Ragudo"
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Via UI go to issue search
# Advance view
# Use a field that requires a user like _assignee_ or _reporter_ and key in the display name/full name of the user

h3. Expected Results
Display name will be recognized as a valid value for the field and search results will be returned.

h3. Actual Results
* Via Search REST API
{code}
{
    "startAt": 0,
    "maxResults": 50,
    "total": 0,
    "issues": [],
    "warningMessages": [
        "The value 'Ian Gil Ragudo' does not exist for the field 'assignee'."
    ]
}
{code}
with a status of 200

* Via issue search in UI
{noformat}
"The value 'Ian Gil Ragudo' does not exist for the field 'assignee'."
{noformat}

h3. Notes
* Does not happen to all cloud instances
* For affected instances, it can be consistently replicated
* First noticed on March 28, 2019
fields.summary: Issue search by using displayName value in JQL no longer works

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Boards don't load when there are more multiple transitions between 2 statuses.
The message below is displayed without informing the root cause:
{code}Hm... don't see your work here?

Don't worry, your issues are still safe and sound. You can't see them here because your current project is not configured to use boards. Learn more about configuring your business projects for boards.{code}

h3. Suggested Solution
Inform the board is not loading due to workflow transitions.
fields.summary: Display a message on board informing there are two issue transitions go to the same status

fields.description:
h3. Description
In the new issue view, attachments added to comments have their size overlaid on top of the comment field.

h3. How to reproduce
# Create a comment containing an attachment
# Click the comment field to add a new comment
# Scroll the page down

h3. Expected results
The attachment will scroll and be placed under the new comment field box

h3. Actual results
The file size is still displayed on top of the new comment field box. Also, this information can be clicked on, and by doing so the attachment preview is displayed
*  !Screen Shot 2019-04-02 at 12.06.14 PM.png|thumbnail! 

* Video of problem being reproduced:  [^designProblem.mov]
fields.summary: Attachment size overlaid in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Description
Some instances have been experiencing problems when performing different operations in Jira. This includes opening issues, opening search results (filters) and other operations.

When checking the application logs, it is possible to observe *Database Exceptions* related to connection pools.

h3. How to reproduce
(!) This behavior is *intermittent*

Although there does not exist a specific set of steps that can be followed to observe this behavior, it may occur when opening issues and running searches, for an example. When the problem occurs, a message saying *{{"The Jira server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down"}}* is presented.
*  !databaseError.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Side note
(!) This bug should not be referenced to *every single occurrence* of this problem (error message), as this message may be returned in other situations as well.
fields.summary: Operations returning "The Jira server could not be contacted..."

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a leading or trailing space is left in the *Inward Description* of an Issue Link Type, it breaks in the new Jira Issue View and hides all of the Issue Linking options

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In the *Issue linking* settings, pick any type (ie :Blocks)
# Edit the type and add a space at the beginning or end of the *Inward Description*
 !Edit_Link_Type_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

Works as normal

 !_KTM-2403__without_space.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

It breaks and none of the Issue linking options are available

 !_KTM-2403__Testing_issue_linking_bug_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

This only happens in the new Jira Issue View. When switching to the old view, you have all of the linking options.

Also, leading or trailing spaces in the 'outward' description or in the name of the link type won't cause this issue.

h3. Fix

Remove the spacing from the *Inward Description* and this should be fixed.
fields.summary: Issue link types breaks when a leading or trailing spaces are included in the Inward Description

fields.description:
{panel:title= Implementation of New Features Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}

At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features.
 You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

It used to be able to change Link Color in color scheme; however, currently Jira only allows admins to specify these two:

* Sidebar
* Text and icon

 !Screenshot 2019-04-02 14.57.04.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a way for admins to specify the color of unvisited and visited links in new Jira issue view.

 !Screen Shot 2016-07-13 at 16.26.49.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

There are several browser extensions available to change style such as:

* https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/change-colors/ageghplgcapnfpdhapeemolbmfccclke?hl=en
* https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/color-links/hiponeioelghhaljfflaaflpccedbdem?hl=en-US

Note that these extensions are not officially supported by Atlassian. Also, consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Ability to change link color for admin

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 18 March 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

There’s a minor delay with adding key issue actions to the dot dialog menu in the new issue view, which means it may not be available before we transition you to the new issue view. Don’t worry: this feature is a priority, and we’re working hard to make sure it’s released as fast as possible. In the meantime, some of these actions are available as keyboard shortcuts (from the nav, go to !https://pf-emoji-service--cdn.us-east-1.prod.public.atl-paas.net/atlassian/question_mark_64.png|width=20,height=20! > *Keyboard shortcuts*), and for now, you can still [temporarily click through to the old view|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/temporarily-click-through-to-the-old-issue-view/] to use its dialog menu.

Regards,

Atlassian
{panel}
If I press Dot "." and type "Epic Link" I don't get to enter the Epic Link.

Most other capabilities within this menu are missing too, including (but not limited to):
 * Status transitions
 * Add story points
 * Log Time
 * Move
 * Delete
fields.summary: Dot "." menu is missing "Epic Link" and other actions

fields.description:

 2) Access your "project settings" [https://\|https:]{your instance}.atlassian.net/projects/INC/settings/details
 3) Change the name of the project to: xpto"
 4) Try to access the project page [https://\|https:]{your instance}.atlassian.net/projects/INC/incidents

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Jira issue description field is not visible in Bitbucket
h3. Environment
 * Bitbucket Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link a Jira issue to Bitbucket using the Issue key
 # Open the issue in Bitbucket

h3. Expected Results

The description field is visible in Bitbucket and Jira
h3. Actual Results

The description field is not visible

No workaround available

fields.description:
This bug seems similar to [CONFCLOUD-65887|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-65887] where the sidebar is returning projects that users have no access to.

It seems that once the user gains access to a project, they will be able to see the project returned in the sidebar recent suggestions even though they no longer have access to it.
h3. Steps to Replicate
 # Provide test user access to a project.
 # Remove access to the project for the test user.
 # Use the test user account to search for the said project on the sidebar.

h3. Expected Results

The sidebar should not show the project in recent since the user has no access to it.
h3. Current Results

The Sidebar shows recent projects that user has no access to.
fields.summary: Side bar recent project returning suggestions that users have no access to

fields.description:

Jira does not have the option to add more than one sprint in an issue
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the option to add more than one sprint in an issue
h3. Why this is important

people use more than one Sprint to separate the efforts done in two separate projects 
h3. Workaround 

(Optional)
fields.summary: Ability To Add More Than One Sprint To An Issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a user is re-ordering a status using the arrows in the order column, the page refreshes but it is not re-ordered

h3. Suggested Solution
When a user is re-ordering a status using the arrows in the order column the status should be re-order instead of being ignored

h3. Why this is important
Customers who are willing to re-ordering a status using the arrows in the order column should be re-ordered.

 [^Statuses - JIRA.webm]
fields.summary: Status re-ordering is ignored

fields.description: I am working in a Next-gen scrum project. I would like to see the done tickets of a completed sprint, so I can easily discuss the projects progress with other departments.
fields.summary: As a Project Owner I want to see the Completed Sprints, So I can report to other departments

When I use the Issue Notify resource with a users 'name' I get the following:

 !Screen Shot 2019-04-01 at 9.42.34 am.png|thumbnail!

However, when I try that same request with the users 'key' I get an internal server error:

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Atlassian does not offer support for IFTTT integrations
h3. Suggested Solution

Atlassian should make plans to support for IFTTT integrations
h3. Why this is important

IFTTT (if this, then that) is the easy, free way to get your apps and devices working together.
fields.summary: Provide support for IFTTT integrations

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, there is no easy way to identify whether the project has been recently updated or not.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability for admins to easily identify when it was the last time an issue has been updated in a specific project

h3. Why this is important
This should ease the administrative task to identify inactive projects.

h3. Workaround 
We can work with *JQL queries* (like "updated > startofmonth() ORDER BY updated ASC") and add a *two dimensional* gadget on a dashboard, so that admins can identify which projects were updated in the last month (for example). This, however, works only for classic projects.
fields.summary: As an admin, I'd like to know when the project has been updated

fields.description:
Very often I find that my team gets lots of notifications through slack, especially for support requests from internal teams. I have been able to create an email relay so that emails to my teams support email address goes to Jira cloud, however there is no such functionality with the slack bot integration.

I propose that the Jira Cloud slack bot should allow a command in a thread to publish the entire thread details into a new Jira ticket and a link to the slack message thread. Or if a ticket already exists from the same thread then it should update the ticket with new details.

This would be very useful to bring all support into one location and not rely on memory for finding which threads have been discussed and which havn't yet.
fields.summary: Allow Jira Slack bot to create tickets

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Currently _XAxis_ and _YAxis_ in *Two Dimensional Filter Statistics* gadget is limited to the fields of following types:
* Group picker
* Multi select
* User picker
* Select list
* Version picker

Other types of fields such as "Number Field" and "Text Field" are not supported.

h3. Suggested solution
Please enhance this gadget to support other field types available in JIRA such as "Number Field".
fields.summary: Enhance supported field types in "Two Dimensional Filter Statistics" gadget

fields.description: Due to security reasons, and considering the customers that deal with sensitive that in their instance, would be useful if the Jira incoming mail handler has the option to restrict the ticket creation if the _from_ of the email matches certain domain(s).
fields.summary: Option to restrict incoming mail handler by domain

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the Days Remaining in Sprint Gadget Doesn't Work with the Auto Option, choosing the "Next Sprint (Auto)" option, doesn't return the next sprint, it keeps the finished sprint.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the Days Remaining in Sprint Gadget in a dashboard
# Choose the option to "Next Sprint(Auto)" and save it

h3. Expected Results
It should return days remaining for the next sprint.

h3. Actual Results
It shows the number of days remaining for an already closed sprint.

h3. Workaround
The workaround would be to choose manually the Sprint in the gadget.
fields.summary: Days Remaining in Sprint Gadget Doesn't Work with the Auto Option

fields.description:
Double quotes search is available on Jira search around some screens (filters, for example). It allows you to search for a specific string on the search instead of match the words of the search.

Would be useful if this kind of search were available in the quick search on the left menu bar. Would help found specific keywords directly on the quick search without the need to enter in Jira submenus.
fields.summary: Ability to use double quotes on the quick search

fields.description: I can get to the sprint board using (g,a,2), but once there I need to grab the mouse to filter a list of issues assigned to me. It would be really helpful to be able to quickly toggle "my issues" with a keyboard shortcut.
fields.summary: Add sprint board keyboard shortcut to toggle "my issues"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User mention that was created on the old issue view may render incorrectly in the new Jira issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Upload a file to an issue ie. "image.png"
- Switch to the old Jira issue view and edit the description
- Use the following markup
{code}
!image.png! 
[~admin]
{code}
- Save the description and switch to the new Jira issue view. 

h3. Expected Results

The mentioned user should be rendered in grey and the image should be displayed.

 !correct mention.png|thumbnail! 



h3. Actual Results

The mentioned user is incorrectly rendered in blue. 

 !bug1.png|thumbnail! 

Furthermore, there is error message when editing in the new Jira issue view :  _The text has unsupported formatting_.

 !bug2.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Notes

Sample markup created in the old view that renders properly when switching to the new view. 

{code}
!image.0360.png|thumbnail! 
[~admin]
{code}
fields.summary: Mention rendering may break on the new Jira issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customer not able to set site's landing product page.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to set the site's landing product page.

h3. Why this is important
Customers should be able to set the site's landing product page.
fields.summary: Ability to set site's landing product page upon login and logout

fields.description: In new issue view, I want to put a large text field between the Description and the Activity section. Ideally, I should be able to put any primary or secondary field there, but I'll be very happy with just a single large text fields (pretty much just like the Description area).
fields.summary: New issue view: add field between Description and Activity Report

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Attempting to edit an issue when the username is "removed" (a Former user), and inactive, is not possible as it displays the following errors:

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a user.
# Create an issue and assign that user to it (same user will be the reporter and the assignee).
# Remove this user from the instance.
# Attempt to edit the issue.

h3. Expected Results

The issue is able to be saved.

h3. Actual Results

When saving the issue, the errors below are presented and the issue cannot be saved:
* If they're the assignee: User 'removed' cannot be assigned issues.
* If they're the reporter: The reporter specified is not a user.

h3. Workaround

This validation is not applied when using Inline Edit, so it's still possible to edit those fields in the issue. Additionally, removing the fields assignee and reporter from the Edit Screen is also a viable workaround.
fields.summary: Is not possible to edit an issue (using the edit button) when the assignee is a "Former user"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-72431].
{panel}
h3. Summary
As a Jira administrator, when editing an Issue collector, and selecting the template as *"Custom"* (as in the screenshot below), there is a list of custom fields that I can select from by checking the box next to it. 

When I check the box, that custom field is added to the *"Template preview"*. 

When I save the changes, the template preview consider the changes but the check-boxes next to the custom fields got back to the empty value. 

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

* The selected checkboxes remains enabled.
* The *"template preview"* shows the selected *"custom fields"*.  

h3. Actual Results
* The selected checkboxes are unchecked. 
* The *"template preview"* shows the selected *"custom fields"* as expected.
 
h3. Notes
* I made this short video that illustrates the behavior:  [^Recording #358.mp4] 

h3.Workaround
* Currently, there is no workaround.
fields.summary: Issue collector custom template checkbox for custom fields is broken

fields.description: When using Kanban, management looking at Jira's resolved. Please allow option to prevent users from moving JIRAs from DONE to a different swim lane.
fields.summary: Option to disable users from moving JIRA from Done to another swimlane

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the user has only numbers as username, whenever a query is made and the user tries to save this query as filter, the username is replaced to "unknown".

Example: assignee = 1234

When trying to save a filter with this query, Jira will replace the JQL to:

assignee = unknown

As show in the video below

 [^JRACLOUD-71799.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Make sure you have an account which username is made only by numbers;
* Perform a query with that specific username (example: assignee = 1234);
* Try to save the query as a filter.

h3. Expected Results
* Jira will save the query as the JQL was queried (assignee = 1234).

h3. Actual Results
* Jira will replace the username for "unknown",

h3. Workaround(s)
* Wrap the username in quotes (assignee = "1234" will solve the problem).
fields.summary: If the username contains only numbers, when saving a filter, Jira will replace the username to "unknown"
Add a "Pull request approved" to workflow triggers

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When sending bulk emails to a huge number of users (> ~500) will cause a timeout

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use the bulk email feature to send bulk email - https://<cloudinstance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/SendBulkMail!default.jspa

h3. Summary

Project search field duplicates entered multibyte text on Chrome.


h3. Environment
* (x) Google Chrome Version 73.0.3683.86 (Official Build) (64-bit)
* (/) Safari Version 12.1 (13607.1.40.1.5)
* (/) Firefox 66.0.1 (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Enter multibyte text in project search field such as "あいう"
# Verify the entered text will be duplicated as "あいうあいう"

Please refer to the attached video:

* Chrome: [^jac-project-search.mov]
* Firefox:  [^jac-project-search-firefox.mov] 

It requires a little knowledge of [IME|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Input_method]. 

h3. Expected Results

Entered text remains as is.

h3. Actual Results

Entered text is duplicated.

h3. Workaround

Delete the duplicated string (trailing "あいう" in the case above) and hit return-button to search again.
Besides, consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Project search field duplicates entered multibyte text on Chrome

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Similar to Issue Type Avatars and Priority Avatars, it would be useful to also have status avatars for certain use cases, and provide a quick visual indication of the status beyond the status color.

One example use case given is for a "aging process" as a request is moved to a new status
For example:
1 day in QA 😊
2 days in QA 🤔
3 days in QA 😞
4 days in QA 😡

h3. Suggested Solution
Add in a Status based Avatar
fields.summary: Add Status Avatars

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a Jira site is set to use a different language, unauthenticated API requests and authenticated users that have not selected their preferred language will always return the response in the system language Jira is currently set to use.

h3. Suggested Solution
It could be helpful in some situations to be able to pass a REST API call an additional parameter that would make sure the response came back in a specific language

h3. Why this is important
For developers that are trying to build integrations and other tools that will catch responses, it becomes much more difficult to try and support all the language packs that might exist for Jira.  It would help developers to be able to specify a single language for their own error checking or response checking in order to troubleshoot.

h3. Workaround 
Change the user's preferred language type before making the request.
fields.summary: Allow REST API responses to also return a non-translated response

fields.description:
h3. Description
Although most email clients support SVG files, some of them still do not. In some cases, Outlook has problems with handling these files, causing them to be displayed as broken images.

Jira uses SVG images in profile avatars. When sending notifications about events triggered from within the application, sometimes these notifications will be displayed with broken images, which is a poor user experience.

h3. Expected behavior
Avatar images should always be displayed. In case they could not be displayed, an alternative should exist so that the client could process the email accordingly

h3. Actual behavior
Some clients cannot handle SVG images and therefore present a broken icon:
 !testOutlook2019.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion
Add some kind of fallback to handle cases where client is unable to process this type of image
fields.summary: Add SVG fallback to handle Account Avatars

h3. Summary
The quick search on the left navigation bar is unable to make predictions. The full word is needed in order to search on a word.

# On the quick search, try searching one of the keywords in the *Summary* (ie: Fulcrum)

If I type "fulc" I expect Jira to already start predicting and suggesting the Issues where the strings "fulc" is found
 !_SCRUM-379_.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A user receives "Schedule Permission" error when trying to edit issue from a sprint. This error occurs due to the Sprint field with *none* value added to the Screen. 

This is the specific scenario for this behavior occur:
* The user should not have Schedule Permission on the project
* The Edit Screen should have the Sprint field
* The Sprint field should be empty (None)
* The edit process should be done on a new page(not the Quick Edit - pop-up)

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new issue on a sprint
# Make sure that the user follows all the conditions above
# Try to edit the issue *on a new tab*(Edit page)

h3. Expected Results
The edit process should occur without error. 

h3. Actual Results
Jira gives a Schedule Permission error even though the user is not changing anything on Sprint. 

h3. Workaround
* Use the Quick Edit (pop-up)
* Edit the issue via New Issue View
fields.summary: Edit Issue page gives "Schedule Permission" error for a specific scenario
In the New Jira Issue View, when creating an inline subtask which has a field required, Jira won't remember the subtask type

h3. Suggested Solution

Show the full filename in the new issue view to avoid any confusion

  Detail: Key (project)=(10001) is not present in table \"project\".
	at com.atlassian.jira.database.DbConnectionImpl.executeRawSql(DbConnectionImpl.java:153)
	at com.atlassian.jira.database.constraints.ForeignKeyConstraint.lambda$getCreator$6(ForeignKeyConstraint.java:118)

  Detail: Key (project)=(10001) is not present in table \"project\".
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.receiveErrorResponse(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2477)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.processResults(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2190)

{code}
h3.Notes
- Although the error message somehow suggests that a Project is missing, we can verify that the specific project exists in the source Jira instance, and also in the XML backup file.
- The detailed logs seems to suggest that the import is attempting to add an invalid entry into the {{issue_type_field_association}} table


h3.Workaround
Remove "Default value" parameter from the problematic entry.
# Unzip the backup file
# Run the Unix command to find the problematic entry: 
{code}
grep IssueTypeFieldAssociation entities.xml -n | grep Json
{code}
# You will get something like this:
{code}
 12345:   <IssueTypeFieldAssociation id="89" issueTypeId="10712" fieldIdentifier="description" position="10178" category="not_configurable" required="false" defaultValue="org.ofbiz.core.entity.JsonBType@2a5edd08" created="2019-01-17 22:11:46.851453" updated="2019-01-17 22:11:47.231065"/>
{code}
** (i) 12345 is the line number
# Remove 'defaultValue' from the line, eg:
{code}
    <IssueTypeFieldAssociation id="89" issueTypeId="10712" fieldIdentifier="description" position="10178" category="not_configurable" required="false"  created="2019-01-17 22:11:46.851453" updated="2019-01-17 22:11:47.231065"/>
{code}
# Zip the backup file and retry the import
fields.summary: Cloud to Cloud Jira import fails with: Key (project)=(10001) is not present in table "project"

fields.description:
h3. Description
Whenever the amount of comments added to an issue exceeds the defined limit for displayable comments, a button saying *{{View x older comments}}* will be presented to display the hidden items.

When using the *New issue view*, comments that have the *exact same* creation date will not be displayed once the button is clicked.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create an issue using an importer tool (e.g. CSV import), defining multiple comments with the *exact same* creation date
# Create more comments, so that the limit of "displayable comments" is exceeded
# Open the issue again, so that the *{{View x older comments}}* is displayed
# Click the *{{View x older comments}}* button
 !Screen Shot 2019-03-21 at 8.32.43 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* Hidden comments are displayed
 !Screen Shot 2019-03-21 at 8.35.52 PM.png|thumbnail! 
** In this case, all comments had *different creation dates*

h3. Actual Results
* Comments are *not displayed*
 !Screen Shot 2019-03-21 at 8.41.35 PM.png|thumbnail! 
** In this case, the first two comments had the *exact same creation date*

h3. Workaround
Disable the *New issue view*
fields.summary: "View x older comments" functionality will not display comments with same creation date in the New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Even though bulk move operation completes without showing any errors on user interface, the tickets are not actually moved to the destination project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search for some issues in using a JQL
{noformat}
project = 'Project A' AND assignee = 'User A' AND resolution = Unresolved ORDER BY priority DESC, updated DESC
{noformat}
# Choose Bulk Operation action
# Choose 'Move Issues' operation
# Complete the wizard by selecting 'Project B' as the destination

h3. Expected Results
Bulk operation completes successfully and moves all the tickets to 'Project B'

h3. Actual Results
- Bulk operation completes 100% without any errors. However, couldn't find the tickets in Project B. The tickets still stays in Project A.
 !Progress in UI.png|thumbnail! 
- Error in browser console:
 !Console Errors.png|thumbnail! 
- Error in server logs:
{noformat}
logger:	 com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.bulkedit.BulkOperationProgress	
message: Bulk edit bean unexpectedly null. Perhaps session was lost (e.g. when URL used is different to base URL in General Configuration)?	
{noformat}

h3. Notes
- This does not occur very frequently and the conditions are unknown.

h3.Workaround
Repeat the operation until it works.
fields.summary: Bulk move operation not moving the tickets sometimes

fields.description:

# You should receive the mail notification
# Open the mail file with an editor

h3. Expected Results

The Japanese text should be encoded as follows.

{code}
Subject: =?utf-8?b?=5BJIRA=5D=20=28TEST=2D1=29=20=E3=83=86=E3=82=B9=E3=83=88?=
{code}

h3. Actual Results

The original Japanese text itself is contained in the subject.

{code}
Subject: [JIRA] (TEST-1) テスト
{code}
 
h3. Notes

Subject in mail notifications which came from Confluence are encoded as expected.

There is no workaround.

fields.description:
h3. Summary:

Adding a large comment ( ~30 lines) in the new issue view makes the comment be displayed in front of all content.

h3. Steps to reproduce:

( Note: It may or may not be reproduced )

1. go to full issue view and click to add a new comment
 2. create a big comment (~30 lines) until the editor text are takes up almost the whole viewport height
 3. scroll the issue view up and down

h3. Expected behaviour: 

Comment would collapse or scroll down so users can see previous comments and description.

h3. Actual behaviour:

Comment sticks in place and prevents the user from seeing pretty much anything else from the issue view.

Before adding a comment:

!Screen Shot 2019-03-21 at 12.46.01.png|thumbnail!

After adding a comment:

!Screen Shot 2019-03-21 at 12.39.08.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround:

Use *see old view* option, or disable new issue view in personal settings.
fields.summary: New issue view comments with large texts are displayed in front of all content

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Trying to add the attachment name in Safari does not work. When you click on the "clip" icon and select the attachment name, there are foreign characters added to the attachment name that prevents JIRA from rendering the name. Therefore, the attachment is not visible on the issue for Service Desk customers, for example.

h3. Environment
* Safari
* JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use Safari
# Attach an image on JIRA with a title including accented characters (e.g. é, ó, ç)
# Use the insert attachment option from your toolbar

h3. Expected Results
In Chrome and Firefox, attaching in this way does display the thumbnail.

h3. Actual Results
In Safari, the name is added but the attachment is not rendered. Converting the attachment name that is added by Safari to HEX we can see foreign characters being added, that are not present when using other browsers.

h3.Workaround
No known workaround. Changing the encoding format of Safari does not work.
fields.summary: Inserting an attachment with accented characters on Safari does not render the file

fields.description:
I am finding that adding more complicated objects into the description and comment fields often cause the description or comment not to be saved, with an error shown. I then have to rewrite or attempt to fix the description or comment.

To make it easier to resolve these issues. I propose a toggle to switch between the markup text and source text.

Old issue view, add comment:

!image-2019-03-21-02-47-00-253.png|width=493,height=220!

New issue view, add comment:

!image-2019-03-21-02-48-56-941.png|width=530,height=237!
----
In raising this suggestion I note you already have these toggles available as "Visual" and "Text", so perhaps I am just missing a setting to enable this in our instance:

!image-2019-03-21-02-58-53-169.png|width=451,height=278!
fields.summary: Make it possible to toggle between markup and source text

fields.description:
The new notification email layout left a white space for the description of the issues on the sides when the email is accessed on a Gmail mobile app. Users have to scroll up and down too much to see a small amount of text which could be more efficient distributed on the screen.
*  !white_spaces.jpeg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Adjust the layout of notification email on Gmail mobile app

fields.description:
h3. Description
When using the new text editor, sometimes the comment field will store an old comment's content after navigating away from the page.

h3. Steps to reproduce
(!) This behavior is intermittent and does not have an exact way to be reproduced, although it has been confirmed that the problem exists

Sometimes, typing a comment and saving it, then navigating away from the issue page and back to it after a while reproduces the problem.

# Create a comment and save it
 !Screen Shot 2019-03-20 at 2.34.35 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Navigate away from the page
# Navigate back to the issue page and add a new comment

h3. Expected results
The comment field will be empty

h3. Actual results
The comment field contains the previous comment's content
 !Screen Shot 2019-03-20 at 2.34.57 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
No existing workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Comment Field Stores Old Comment Content

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When highlighting text from the right to the left, the highlighted in not retained:
 !jira_edit_select_not_working_ff66.gif! 

Behaviour:
* Firefox (66.0): when you start from the right (the cursor is in the right), the highlighted is not kept. And if you do not change the cursor's position, you keep having the same behaviour when going from the left to the right:  [^Text highlight.mp4] 
* Chrome (73.0.3683.75): the same happens when you start the highlight from the right to the left, but it does not keep the behaviour when you make the way back.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to reproduce

Simply highlight the text, starting from the right (end of the word).

h3. Expected results

The text will stay highlighted when you move the cursor to the start of the word.

h3. Actual results

The highlight is not retained.

h3. Workaround

Highlight from the start of the word to avoid that behaviour.
fields.summary: The highlight is not retained when done from the right to the left

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When accessing the Projects's list (https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa) using Firefox, if you try to open a project on a new tab by clicking on the project name using the third click, Jira ignores the third click to open the project on a new tab and open on the same page. 

It works on other browsers, like Chrome.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the Projects' list (https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa) 
# Click on the Project name, using the third click

h3. Expected Results
The project is opened on a new tab

h3. Actual Results
The project open on the same tab

h3. Workaround
User can hold the Crtl/Cmd key on the keyboard and click on the project to open it on a new tab
fields.summary: On the Projects' list, Jira doesn't open a project on a new tab on Firefox

fields.description:
The following information is not available in this documentation, It would be great to have this information visible.
1. The *+* will be hidden from the board if the *Sprint* feature is enabled. 
Meaning that once the feature is enabled, you would need to create the new issue from the *Backlog* section as the board is changed to Scrum from Kanban.
2. This *+* is only visible on Kanban board.
fields.summary: Need to update the Next-Gen documentation

fields.description:
As a Product Owner, in the new issue view on Cloud for NextGen projects (if the latter matters), I want to write a "narrative" about an issue which my product designer will turn into exact requirements for implementation and enter into the description. The narrative may contain background information, rationale, and other material that is not relevant to a developer. I want the narrative to appear below description and above the Activity. Currently, we have a custom Narrative field, but it appears on the side with the other primary and secondary fields, and since it is usually a largish amount of text, is unusable there. Which means I have to go back to the old view where I've put the Narrative in a separate tab (next to the "Field Tab", whatever that means) to read and edit it. But I want to use the new view!!!

In summary, I want to be able to change the layout of new issue view main body, at least in this limited way.
fields.summary: New issue view: add text field below description
